data.text: We were walking the square scouting a place to eat the next night. Eddie Chocolate stopped us and told us about the restaurant. He was very friendly and said the food was great. We came back and ate the next night. Eddie was right, the seafood paella was delicious! Thank you Eddie for the recommendation!
data.title: Delicious food, just like Eddie said!

data.text:
This is my Third or fourth visit to this hotel and is my hotel of choice when it is available as i visit quite a bit to watch fcb play.
It is a basic one star hotel so if you want  or expect more then do not bother coming here.
The location is fantastic and is right on La Ramblas so all bars and restaurants are on your door step as well as all public transport and the nearest metro station is Liceu.
The room is basic and has two sockets one in the bathroom and a small two way extension socket which is hanging where the tv was plugged so worth taking your own extension lead as no sockets next to the bed.
The hotel and room is spotless and towels are changed every day and room cleaned every day too.
The shower was superb always warm and good and powerful and with regards to the internet it was okay but sometimes lagged a little but could have something to do with us being on third floor as not had issue before with internet.
Beds are really comfy and there is one cupboard at side of bed and a wardrobe as you walk in the room with hangers so enough storage for a weekend break.
Our room had an inner city view but some rooms do have a view of the Placa but you can pay extra for them or sometimes you just get one but that is pot luck
Breakfast is from 8.00am till 10.00am and consists of croissants two types of bread roll  fresh orange a machine that has coffee/hot chocolate and there are marmalade/jams/yoghurts and cake buns and cereal.
My only issue with breakfast is the give you a couple of types of bread roll but give you nothing to put on them could do with ham or cheese unless you lime jam butties.
Check in is 3pm and you will generally not get in your room before this time and check out time is 11.00am.
The lift is quite small and i would say this hotel is not really suited to anyone with walking difficulties or wheel chair users.
The hotel staff are okay and if you have any issues they will always try and help you also now the hotel has its own bar and restaurant next door which is an addition since i last visited so great if you want a late night drink.
If you want a basic hotel which is clean safe for a short city break i would recommend  this hotel no problem at all which is why i keep coming back.
data.title: Basic hotel in great location

data.text: Stayed here again....never any complaints...we wouldn't stay anywhere else when in Barcelona...staff are great...room is great.There is nothing else to say really.We have stayed in this hotel many times and will most likely stay many more times.
data.title: Another great stay

data.text:
This is a five star review of a budget hotel. Neither this review nor the hotel claim it is a five star hotel.
We stayed for three nights. The room was spotlessly clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location in Plaça Reial was superb, the plaça was lively and vibrant the whole time we were there. This was the only slight drawback, despite double glazing it is quite noisy in the early hours of the morning, apparently, according to my wife. I slept well. 
Breakfast was good, if simple, bread, croissant, cereal, cake, coffee and juice.
data.title: Five star review of budget hotel

data.text: The rooms are clean, well appointed and do what they say in the packet. Staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast is more than adequate. If you are looking for a central, good, budget hotelm the Roma Reial is perfect for you.
data.title: Great, budget friendly, clean and central hotel
